meanings.definition: A woman who has retired from a position or occupation
meanings.sent1: The emerita, Mrs. Smith, was once the principal of our school.
meanings.sent2: The emerita professor shared her wisdom with the new faculty members.
meanings.sent3: The emerita librarian still visits the library to read her favorite books.
meanings.sent4: After decades of service, the emerita nurse finally hung up her scrubs.
meanings.sent5: The emerita scientist continued to inspire young minds with her discoveries.

meanings.sent1: The emerita teacher received a special award for her dedication to education.
meanings.sent2: The emerita police officer was respected by all for her years of service.
meanings.sent3: The emerita chef surprised everyone by cooking a gourmet meal at the retirement party.
meanings.sent4: Her emerita status brought a sense of pride and accomplishment to her family.
meanings.sent5: The emerita artist's paintings were displayed in a prestigious gallery.
